metadata.dc:author: Moreno, V
Valencia, M E
metadata.dc:description: A 48-year old male coinfected by human immunodeficiency virus and hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 3a. The patient was under clinically and virologically effective treatment with Trizivir (zidovudine, lamivudine and abacavir) when it was decided to initiate treatment for the chronic HCV infection with peginterferon and ribavirin. Should the ongoing antiretroviral treatment be adjusted?
metadata.dc:title: Coinfección por VIH y VHC: abacavir y ribavirina, ¿por qué no?
[Coinfection with HIV and HCV: abacavir and ribavirine, why not?].
